wikipedia_page.main: Harry Hiams (1886 – 10 April 1954) was a Welsh international forward who played club rugby for Swansea and Llanelli. He won two caps for Wales and played for Llanelli against the touring South Africans. During the First World War, Hiams served with the Royal Field Artillery.

response: *10 April – Harry Hiams, rugby union international, 67
